data: Fragments of a monumental Greek inscription
Inscriptiones Segestanae. Le iscrizioni greche e latine di Segesta
Carmine Ampolo e Donatella Erdas, Inscriptiones Segestanae. Le iscrizioni greche e latine di Segesta (Pisa: Edizioni della Normale, 2019)

Fragments of trabeation with parts of the upper moulded cornice, with inscribed face below, most likely from the external frieze of the north side of the portico of the bouleuterion. There seems little reason to doubt from the form and style that these are all fragments of the same inscription. Fragment (a) is W 30 x H 19.5 x D 17 cm; (b) is W 28.5 x H 9 x D 10.5 cm; (c) is W 41 x H 24.5 x D31.5; (d) is W 30.5 x H 20.5 x D 22.5 cm; fragment (e), two joining fragments, W 40.25 x H 21 x D 11 cm.
Part of a single line of large Greek letters
Alpha with broken bar; Kappa with short arms; omicron slightly smaller and above the line; standard four-bar sigma with parallel top and bottom strokes. Fine v-cut letters
2nd — 1st century BCE (if part of the bouleterion, then later C2 BCE)

(a) was found in 1993 in a collapse layer (US3926) of SAS 3; (b) was found in 1991, in SAS 3, US 3145; (c) was found in 1993 in a collapse layer (US3926) of SAS 3; (d) was found in 1990 in SAS 3 (amb. 1, collapse layer US 3096), in the vicinity of the bouleuterion; (e) was found in 1993 in SAS 3, US 3926 and 3973.
Case Barbaro - contrada Barbaro S.R. 22, 91013 Calatafimi
Giuseppe Nenci, «Florilegio epigrafico segestano», Annali della Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa, Classe di Lettere e Filosofia 21 (1991): 920–29
appendice: fonti letterarie, epigrafiche, numismatiche, etc.
Stefania De Vido, «appendice: fonti letterarie, epigrafiche, numismatiche, etc.», Annali della Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa, Classe di Lettere e Filosofia 21 (1991): 929–94
Giuseppe Nenci, «Iscrizioni greche e latine», Annali della Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa, Classe di Lettere e Filosofia ser.3, 25, fasc. 4 (1995): 1182–87
Jonathan Prag combined the fragments into a single file
De Vido, 1991, appendice: fonti letterarie, epigrafiche, numismatiche, etc.
Ampolo and Erdas, 2019, Inscriptiones Segestanae. Le iscrizioni greche e latine di Segesta

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of ISegesta;
  • a.1: As noted in I.Segesta, the second letter could alternatively be Γ
  • β.1: As noted in I.Segesta, the first letter could alternatively be omega
  • d.1: As noted in I.Segesta, the second letter seems unlikely to be an alpha in comparison to other fragments from the same area.

translation

commentary

Five fragments from the area of the bouleuterion, which are highly likely to belong to the same monumental text from the facade of the bouleuterion portico on the north side of the building.

There seems little reason to doubt from the form and style that these are all fragments of the same inscription.
